Ad Text:
We’ve been proudly serving Australian communities since 1914 and have grown to become a top 30-listed company on the ASX with a portfolio of iconic homegrown brands. At the heart of our continued success is over 115,000 team members working across the country, all contributing to bringing our customers smiles. You’ll not only get to see your work make a difference, you’ll be part of a team working together to help Australians eat and live better every day.

About the team

Our Technology team is the backbone of the business, building and maintaining the information technology infrastructure that support Coles Group. As a part of the Technology team, you get the opportunity to work through complex, challenging, meaningful problems using large data sets and new technologies to expand your skills and experience.

About the team

As the way Australians shop continues to evolve, our Technology team keeps Coles at the forefront of modern retail. We combine data, artificial intelligence, and applied engineering to reimagine how our stores, supply chain, forecasting and digital channels operate — creating smarter, more connected, and seamless experiences for our customers and team members.

Operating as a centralised development and enablement function within Coles Technology, the team unites product, engineering, and platform capabilities to deliver the intelligence layer of the enterprise. We serve every part of Coles — from computer vision applications that enhance in-store experiences and reduce loss, to forecasting, optimisation, and decision-support solutions that drive efficiency, accuracy, and agility across our supply chain, retail operations, and corporate functions.

The scale and impact of this work are significant. Coles serves millions of customers each week across more than a thousand stores nationwide, and our AI and data capabilities provide the intelligence that underpins how we plan, move, sell, and serve. By combining deep data capability with applied AI and modern engineering, we’re enabling Coles to become a truly AI-enabled enterprise, transforming how we operate and how Australia shops every day.





About the role

As a Product Delivery Lead, you will be responsible for enabling successful scoping, prioritisation and discovery delivery of multiple product initiatives across the organisation. Leading the team of 8-10 analysts, you will play key role in front door demand management, translating business demand into structured, prioritised delivery work while balancing team capacity. You are a leader who combines strong project and delivery management capability with a modern product mindset.

 Key responsibilities include

 Own and operate the front door intake process for new initiatives, requests, and change demand.
Assess, size, prioritise, and sequence incoming work in partnership with Product, Technology, and Business leaders
Lead the end‑to‑end delivery of product initiatives and projects across parallel workstreams.
Apply strong project management discipline to planning, scheduling, dependency management, risk mitigation, and reporting.
Own capacity planning and utilisation for a team of 8–10 analysts, ensuring sustainable workloads across initiatives.
Allocate people effectively based on skills, availability, and delivery priorities.
Lead, coach, and support a high‑performing team of analysts across multiple projects and squads.
Act as a primary point of coordination between Product, Technology and broader business teams
Facilitate governance forums, planning sessions, and prioritisation discussions.

About You and Your Skills

Demonstrated people leadership experience managing 8+ analysts or delivery professionals
Strong background in project management, including planning, risk management, and multi‑stream delivery
Proficient experience using project management and forecasting tools
Hands‑on experience with front door intake, demand management, and portfolio prioritisation
Strong capability in capacity planning and resource management in complex delivery environments
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills 

What’s in it for you?

Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

Job ID: 174615

Employment Type: Full time

#LI-ECOM1

Client
We are partnering with a high-performing, global organisation in the sporting goods sector to appoint a Finance Business Partner within their ANZ business. This is a pivotal role for an analytically strong and commercially astute finance professional who thrives on partnering across the business to drive insight, performance and sustainable growth.

About the Role
Reporting into senior leadership, the Finance Business Partner will deliver strategic financial insight, robust reporting and value-adding analysis to both executive stakeholders and operational teams. This role suits someone who can turn complex financial data into clear, actionable insights, confidently challenge assumptions, and support informed decision-making across a diverse, fast-paced environment.

You will partner closely with functions including Supply Chain, IT, HR, Customer Service and Sales/Operations, making demonstrated cross-functional business partnering experience essential. The role also includes one direct report and offers exposure to both local and regional strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Provide high-quality financial insights, modelling and analysis to support business performance and informed decision-making
Lead end-to-end budgeting and forecasting processes, ensuring alignment with broader strategic objectives
Proactively identify risks, opportunities and emerging trends to influence commercial outcomes
Support monthly and quarterly performance reviews, partnering closely with senior stakeholders
Ensure strong adherence to internal controls, financial governance and compliance standards
Partner cross-functionally to drive efficiencies, inform channel strategy and support operational teams
Lead, coach and develop a finance analyst, fostering capability and performance
About You

CA or CPA qualified
Experience in FP&A, commercial finance, or business partnering
Strong track record influencing senior stakeholders across multiple functional areas
Excellent analytical and modelling capability (Excel, Power BI advantageous)
Able to communicate complex financial information clearly and meaningfully
Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, multi-channel environment
Why This Role?
You’ll join a collaborative, commercially driven environment where finance plays a central role in shaping strategy. This position offers significant exposure to senior leadership, genuine ownership of core business processes, and the opportunity to directly impact the performance trajectory of a globally recognised organisation.
Looking for a commercial finance leader who can influence across the business and drive smarter, faster decisions

How to apply:
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Will Nichols at wnichols@sharpandcarter.com.au

Job Title: Finance Analyst | ASX Listed Firm | 6 Month FTC, view to Perm | Immediate Start
Ad Text:
The Opportunity


Our client is an ASX listed business, join a growing, complex organisation in a highly visible and commercially impactful Finance Analyst role.

Working within a collaborative finance team, you will play a key part in delivering critical insights across financial performance, supporting operational leaders, and improving reporting capability.


This role is well suited to a technically strong and analytically minded finance professional who enjoys partnering with the business, driving improvements, and contributing to budgeting, forecasting and broader commercial decision‑making.


The Challenge


Reporting to a senior finance leader, your responsibilities will include:
Preparing monthly management reports, including analysis of financial performance against budget and forecast
Completing month‑end accounting including reconciliations, journals, and project reporting
Supporting half‑year and full‑year statutory reporting requirements
Delivering budgeting and forecasting across key functions and projects
Providing commercial insight, variance commentary, modelling and trend analysis
Completing cashflow forecasting and ad hoc commercial analysis (including business case modelling)
Partnering with Finance, Operational, Sales and Project teams to improve performance outcomes
Supporting ongoing systems and process improvement initiatives, including reporting enhancements
Contributing to integration activity and M&A support where required
Assisting with internal and external audit requirements and ensuring robust financial controls
The Expertise


Please consider expressing interest if you possess:
Degree qualifications in Accounting with CA/CPA (or CFA)
Strong financial modelling capability, including advanced Excel skills and experience with Power BI
Experience in budgeting, forecasting, cost reporting and business partnering
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to translate data into meaningful insights
Excellent communication skills, strong stakeholder‑engagement capability and a continuous‑improvement mindset
Ability to work independently, prioritise effectively and meet required deadlines
The Next Step


If this position will enhance your career and you would like further details on the client, the role, remuneration or a copy of the position description, please call Simon Gvalda for a confidential discussion on 0409 656 793.
Alternatively, please apply via the link below.


About ThompsonCook


ThompsonCook fosters strong relationships with top accounting and finance professionals across Australia. We recruit for key finance function roles, including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll, Financial Accountants, Management Accountants, Finance Managers, Financial Controllers, and Chief Financial Officers, as well as positions in Treasury, Tax, and Audit. We support our clients with both permanent and contracting recruitment solutions.


ThompsonCook | We Only Do Accounting | Focused on Melbourne and Sydney
